Tesla.title: Software Development Engineer Intern
data: Contributed to the development of software utilized globally across Tesla's Gigafactories on the Factory Software Team using Angular, React.js, Next.js, Go, MySQL, Docker and Kubernetes.
Migrated the factory streaming app from React.js to Next.js and implemented new features in core factory operations, subscription management, and streaming portals.

Northeastern University - RA.title: Frontend Developer - Research Assistant
data: Worked on incorporating the SurveyJs Form library into Home Assistant, an open-source home automation software, to collect information about thermostat use from home users and gather data on temperature and thermostat settings over time.

Researchers will use this data to determine how much people are willing to adjust their thermostat settings during times of high power grid demand without sacrificing comfort. The goal is to promote energy efficiency and encourage more flexible thermostat use.
Skills: HTML, CSS, Javascript, JQuery, Web Components, Lit library, Docker, SurveyJs, and Home Assistant.

Northeastern University.title: Frontend Developer
data: Developed a React.js portfolio web application for a professor with an automated CI/CD pipeline to deploy changes to the Google Cloud Platform using GitHub Actions and Node.js.

Reliance Retail Limited.title: Software Engineer
data: Worked with and oversaw a team of 6 employees on developing an e-commerce marketplace web app using Next.js, Node.js, and Express.js for faster page loads.

Reduced the number of unnecessary API calls to the server from many to one during a search, click, and event tracking activity, resulting in a 10% improvement in web performance of the company’s multiple web apps.

Ninjacart.title: Software Engineer
data: Built 8 responsive web apps, including the Angular WebView apps, enabling me to leverage a variety of mobile device functionalities.
Configured 12 front-end modules and added numerous web optimization strategies to further boost applications performance by 20%.

Single-handedly developed Ninjacart’s Communication service using Angular, enabling multiple employee roles to communicate with each other seamlessly. Some of its main features include notification posting and employee training activities.
Educated and conducted multiple hands-on workshops for 300 new employees regarding Core Javascript, Angular, and React.js.
Introduced a Live tracking feature in the already existing AppManagement UI, where we can track the live moment of the people.
Functioned as a UI developer on newly started B2C flows where will be supplying the vegetables, groceries directly to the customers home instead of CC’s, FC’s, MDC’s, MMDC’s.
Served as a Backend developer on one of the features in AppManagement microservice where we can move the mapped users between different app versions.

Class bridge.title: Frontend Engineer
data: Class Bridge was a 3 people engineering team and has engineered Online Institution Management Portal using React.js.
Performed as an only Frontend developer and developed 20 UI-rich modules that helped students, teachers, and institute managers across a few schools and colleges in India.
Some of its main features like creating institutes, classes and sections, teachers, students, exams, scheduling exams, timetables, live chat, and conducting online classes.

Ninjacart-Intern.title: Software Developer Intern
data: Solely developed a UI microservice called AppManagement from scratch using Angular for managing different builds (versions) of mobile applications in people's mobile phones across different cities, facilities, and store levels.
More than 12,000 users across 10 cities have been using this application for managing android app versions and more features.
Some of its primary features include app release, mapping users across multiple facilities, app download, and reviewing user-app-related details.

Virtusa.title: Software Developer Intern
data: Handled both frontend (Angular) and backend (SpringBoot), where converted 1 old user interface and a few APIs to new ones.

Legal Education Awareness Foundation.title: Software Developer Intern
data: Worked as a Remote Intern on the frontend side of the responsive websites.
Involved in the creation of a consulting and olympiad website for the purpose of conducting olympiad exams for students, both of which are hosted by Godaddy.

projects.title: Event Ding
projects.description: Engineered a next-generation event hosting website allowing Northeastern University administrators and students to host and book events.

projects.title: Splitter
projects.description: Constructed a website where splitting expenses among groups of individuals can be done in an easier fashion.

projects.description: It's an Online School Management Portal. Some of its main features like creating institutes, classes and sections, teachers, students, exams, scheduling exams, timetables, live chat, and conducting online classes.

projects.title: Website for Google Developer Student Club @ SASTRA (DSC)
projects.description: Programmed a website for my undergraduate university's Developer Student Club (DSC).

projects.title: Exam Automata
projects.description: Created a website that anyone can use to host and administer online exams.

projects.title: Gamestore
